Andrew Sturman

Software engineer with a passion for creating and learning

Personal Projects

InTeam

React
TypeScript
.NET 5
Postgres

Web application designed to add game elements to software development project courses to improve team effectiveness. Students can create custom profiles, change their avatars and give badges to other team members. They can also earn points for improving their team's position on a leaderboard.

Xylo

Swift
iOS

iOS application introducing people to the world of music and inspiring their creativity through Xylophone musical minigames. Users can learn new songs and improve pitch detection and memory skills. Points earned by playing can be spent on in-game keyboard customisation

PetitionThis

Vue
Node
Express
MariaDB

Full stack web application developed using Vuejs/Vuetify for the client and Node/Express/MariaDB for the server. Users can create, view, search, and sign petitions. Hosted with Netlify and Heroku.

Sudoku Solver

Python
TKinter

Desktop application developed using Python and TKinter. Users can complete puzzles, generate new ones, and watch the computer solve them automatically with a depth first search backtracking algorithm

Slower than light

Java
Swing

A turn based strategy/adventure game developed with a friend. Form your unique team of crewmembers and try assemble the missing pieces of your ship so your crew can go home. Watch out for space pirates!

Te Reo

Java
Android

A mobile application developed with Java aimed to teach New Zealanders the basic spelling and pronounciation of Te Reo Maori. Users can tap the screen to hear words from the numbers, family, colours and phrases categories.

Steven's Piano

HTML
CSS
Javascript

A static website created using HTML, CSS and Javascript. This website is for a street musician/concert pianist "Steven" who is looking to take on new clients for tutoring, and reach a wider audience.

Yahtzee Roller

Kotlin
Android

A simple mobile application developed with Android/Kotlin designed to be used while playing yahtzee. The user is able to roll a set of five dice, for up to three turns, choosing which dice they would like to reroll.
